Description.Title: Refreezing
Description.ExtendedDescription: Refreezing is a STICS snow-module submodel that estimates the daily amount of liquid water within the snowpack that refreezes when air temperature is below a melt threshold. It applies a degree-day formulation: the refreezing rate equals a temperature index (SWrf) times the difference between the melting threshold (Tmf) and the average temperature (tavg) when tavg < Tmf; otherwise refreezing is zero. Outputs are expressed as mm of liquid water per day.
Description.ShortDescription: Degree-day refreezing submodel for snow in STICS: Mrf = SWrf × (Tmf − tavg) when tavg < Tmf, else 0.

Output.name: Mrf
Output.description: liquid water in the snow cover in the process of refreezing

Function.name: model_refreezing
Function.description: Computes refreezing amount as SWrf * (Tmf - tavg) when tavg < Tmf, otherwise 0.
